channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report I-2024050064
item.description:
Report I-2024050064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T00:37:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 1:43 AM on 05/16/24, notification was received that the tank car was leaking product (Sulfuric Acid, Spent) from the top and down the side. The car was located in our Manchester Yard and our contractor, Haz-Mat Special Services, was immediately contacted. HMSS identified the issue as three of the four bolts securing the fill hole cover were less than tool-tight. HMSS was able to tighten the bolts and resolved the leak.

item.title: Report E-2024080077
item.description:
Report E-2024080077

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 25, 2024, one (1) 7-gallon pail of oxidizer pellets toppled in transit and released approximately its full contents to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to remediate the site. E3 personnel utilized hand tools to remediate the trailer floor. The crew containerized the released material in its original 7-gallon pail for further transport and shipment.

item.title: Report E-2024080001
item.description:
Report E-2024080001

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1268 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. ES&H personnel arrived and discovered that R+L personnel had placed granular absorbents to the spilled product. ES&H began remedial actions by sweeping all absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon waste drum. The crew then placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack. ES&H staged both drums onsite for future shipping.

item.description:
Report I-2024070154

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: Mie
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TANCLET LOGISTICS INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While unloading, a leak from the air line occurred. Approximately 15 gallons of product were released onto asphalt. Lone Star Hazmat Response was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Lone Star Hazmat Response utilized a powerwasher to clean the impacted asphalt surface. Lone Star Hazmat Response collected the rinse water and placed it into one(1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024072458
item.description:
Report X-2024072458

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-05T15:15:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DMP WAS DISPATCHED FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE DRIPPING FROM OUTSIDE THE YARD INSIDE AN ALREADY LOADED OUTBOUND DOOR. UPON ARRIVAL, DMP UNLOAD OUTBOUND DOOR TO REACH ORIGIN OF LEAKING MATERIAL. UPON DISCOVERY, DMP LOCATED THE MATERIAL "HANDI FOAM" NON FLAMMABLE GAS HAZARD SYMBOL. DMP RETRIEVED THE MATERIAL AND TOOK IT OUTDOORS TO ATTEMPT TO CLOSE THE VALVE. MATERIAL WAS RETURNED TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING. NO DRUMS WERE AVAILABLE AT THE TIME TO PROPERLY STORE MATERIAL.

item.title: Report X-2024072393
item.description:
Report X-2024072393

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Preload thought the package was damaged and 99'd it on the 25th. I did not see it until the 26th and upon inspection I determined it wasn't damaged beyond the outer box having been splashed by something. The actual item inside was perfectly fine, I tested it and even had it sit out for a few hours to see if it leaked. Once I determined it wasn't damaged, I reboxed it and wrapped it in bubble wrap and spill pads, then set it out to be put on the vans by Preload. When I came in today I found it back at the hazmat cage with a puncture in the bottom of the bottle.

item.title: Report X-2024072422
item.description:
Report X-2024072422

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: MC ALLEN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PM CLERK FOUND LEAKING STEEL DRUM AMONG CLERICAL PACKAGES AND CALLED PM HAZMAT RESPONDER, WHO DONNED PPE, TOOK A SPILL CART AND RESPONDED TO THE INCIDENT. STEEL DRUM WAS LEAKING VERY SLOWLY (DROP BY DROP), SO THE SPILL WAS MINIMAL. STEEL DRUM WAS TAKEN TO DMP, AND ONCE THE LEAK WAS DETERMINED TO BE COMING FROM THE BOTTOM SEAL OF THE DRUM AND THAT IT THEREFORE COULDN'T BE KEPT FROM LEAKING FURTHER, THE ENTIRE CONTENTS WERE SOLIDIFIED WITH ZEP SORBENT AND GREEN-BAGGED.

item.title: Report X-2024072288
item.description:
Report X-2024072288

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DMP WAS DISPATCHED FOR A LEAKING MATERIAL AT UNLOAD DOOR 49 - UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE WAS IDENTIFIED AS A HAZMAT. DMP RESPONDER SECURED THE MATERIAL AND RETURNED TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSSING. UPON PROCESSING AT THE DMP, HAZMAT AUDITOR INITIALS WERE NOT LEGIBLE. DMP RESPONDER RECEIVED ASSITANCE FROM BUILDING HAZMAT AUDITOR TO RECOVER AUDITOR INTIALS.

item.title: Report E-2024070766
item.description:
Report E-2024070766

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 19, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services (CES) who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbent pads and degreaser to remediate the impacted site. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The three (3) damaged pails were collected in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024070761
item.description:
Report E-2024070761

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN3469, Klean Strip Premium Stripper release from (7) 1-gallon metal cans. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the boxes the cans were in and estimated that 0.5-gallons of material was released due to being crushed because of improper loading. The release impacted the cardboard packaging and pallet on the trailer. The damaged cans were placed into a55-gallon poly drum along with damaged and impacted cardboard. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
